channel.title: Open Office
channel.description:
Well I don't know if this has been posted before but Open Office is basically the same thing as all other microsoft products (i.e. msw 07, powerpoint, etc) and can open MSW07 files or powerpoint words and has the same method and ui as all microsoft products. It includes all of them.
http://www.openoffice.org/
Enjoy

item.description:

Wyrmcabbage:

I prefer OpenOffice. For one, it’s made by Oracle (not a legit reason, just my opinion) and it’s free yet has all the capabilities of MS Office.

item.title: Open Office
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

This reminds me when my older sister bought her laptop. A guy in the shop presented MS Office as something she had to get.

End of story: She went back to the shop and get her money back after I told her it was a bad idea and $200 saved.

item.title: Open Office
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:304299”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=400590.msg3055846#msg3055846 date=1260463507]
open office fails in many areas
[/quote]

So does microsoft office, in areas such as cross platform compatibility, cost, Look and Feel, and even areas such as document compatibility between different versions of microsoft office. How do you feel open office fails?[/quote]

usability.

honestly, open-office is on par or better with ms office as far as features go. however, open-office is routinely slow, and has had quite a few formatting and conversion problems in my experience.

i wouldn’t go so far as to say it fails, just that it has a lot of room for improvement…

Read full topic
